page.title: 03Little Cornard.Pop.322
page.content: Little Cornard is a rural village overlooking the Stour Valley.It has no real centre as a village except for the parish church.There is no public house, no post office, no shops.There is, however,a travelling baker,and a travelling green grocer who calls once a week,and a library van which calls once every two weeks.There are three milk rounds,and a Sunday paper delivery .There are several thriving clubs.There is no school now,but the old school building is today used as the village hall.There is one telephone kiosk, one street light, and one bus shelter. Little Cornard lends its name to the well known hymn of the same name, composed by Ralph Bourne Williams, whilst visiting the village.
